member.summary: Determines whether the specified ushort is in the range of the status code for the WebSocket connection close.

item.term: 1000-2999: These numbers are reserved for definition by the WebSocket protocol.
3000-3999: These numbers are reserved for use by libraries, frameworks, and applications.
4000-4999: These numbers are reserved for private use.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.WebSocket
member.summary: Implements the WebSocket interface.

remarks.para: This class provides a set of methods and properties for two-way communication using the WebSocket protocol.
The WebSocket protocol is defined in RFC 6455.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.EmptyBytes
member.summary: Represents the empty array of used internally.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.FragmentLength
member.summary: Represents the length used to determine whether the data should be fragmented in sending.

remarks.para: The data will be fragmented if that length is greater than the value of this field.
If you would like to change the value, you must set it to a value between 125 and Int32.MaxValue - 14 inclusive.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.RandomNumber
member.summary: Represents the random number generator used internally.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with and optionally .

param.name: url
param.para: A that specifies the URL to which to connect.
The scheme of the URL must be ws or wss.
The new instance uses a secure connection if the scheme is wss.

param.name: protocols

member.name: P:WebSocketSharp.WebSocket.Origin
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the HTTP Origin header to send with the handshake request.

remarks.para:
The HTTP Origin header is defined in
Section 7 of RFC 6454.
This instance sends the Origin header if this property has any.
The set operation does nothing if the connection has already been established or it is closing.

value.para: A that represents the value of the Origin header to send.
The syntax is <scheme>://<host>[:<port>].
The default value is .

member.exception: The set operation is not available if this instance is not a client.

exception.para: The value specified for a set operation is not an absolute URI string.
The value specified for a set operation includes the path segments.

member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate used to validate the HTTP cookies included in a WebSocket handshake request to the service.

The delegate invokes the method called when the WebSocket instance for a session validates the handshake request.
1st parameter passed to the method contains the cookies to validate if present.
2nd parameter passed to the method receives the cookies to send to the client.
The method must return true if the cookies are valid.
The default value is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the delegate used to validate the Origin header included in a WebSocket handshake request to the service.

The parameter passed to the method is the value of the Origin header or if the header is not present.
The method must return true if the header value is valid.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of the HTTP status codes.
member.remarks: The HttpStatusCode enumeration contains the values of the HTTP status codes defined in RFC 2616 for the HTTP/1.1.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Continue
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 100. Indicates that the client should continue with its request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 101. Indicates that the server is switching the HTTP version or protocol on the connection.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.OK
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 200. Indicates that the client's request has succeeded.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 201. Indicates that the client's request has been fulfilled and resulted in a new resource being created.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 202. Indicates that the client's request has been accepted for processing, but the processing hasn't been completed.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 203. Indicates that the returned metainformation is from a local or a third-party copy instead of the origin server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 204. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request but doesn't need to return an entity-body.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 205. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the client's request, and the user agent should reset the document view which caused the request to be sent.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 206. Indicates that the server has fulfilled the partial GET request for the resource.

MultipleChoices is a synonym for Ambiguous.
Equivalent to status code 300. Indicates that the requested resource corresponds to any of multiple representations.
Ambiguous is a synonym for MultipleChoices.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
MovedPermanently is a synonym for Moved.
Equivalent to status code 301. Indicates that the requested resource has been assigned a new permanent URI and any future references to this resource should use one of the returned URIs.
Moved is a synonym for MovedPermanently.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Found is a synonym for Redirect.
Equivalent to status code 302. Indicates that the requested resource is located temporarily under a different URI.
Redirect is a synonym for Found.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
SeeOther is a synonym for RedirectMethod.
Equivalent to status code 303. Indicates that the response to the request can be found under a different URI and should be retrieved using a GET method on that resource.
RedirectMethod is a synonym for SeeOther.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 304. Indicates that the client has performed a conditional GET request and access is allowed, but the document hasn't been modified.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 305. Indicates that the requested resource must be accessed through the proxy given by the Location field.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 306. This status code was used in a previous version of the specification, is no longer used, and is reserved for future use.

TemporaryRedirect is a synonym for RedirectKeepVerb.

RedirectKeepVerb is a synonym for TemporaryRedirect.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadRequest
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 400. Indicates that the client's request couldn't be understood by the server due to malformed syntax.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 401. Indicates that the client's request requires user authentication.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 402. This status code is reserved for future use.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 403. Indicates that the server understood the client's request but is refusing to fulfill it.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 404. Indicates that the server hasn't found anything matching the request URI.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 405. Indicates that the method specified in the request line isn't allowed for the resource identified by the request URI.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 406. Indicates that the server doesn't have the appropriate resource to respond to the Accept headers in the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 407. Indicates that the client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 408. Indicates that the client didn't produce a request within the time that the server was prepared to wait.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 409. Indicates that the client's request couldn't be completed due to a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 410. Indicates that the requested resource is no longer available at the server and no forwarding address is known.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 411. Indicates that the server refuses to accept the client's request without a defined Content-Length.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 412. Indicates that the precondition given in one or more of the request headers evaluated to false when it was tested on the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 413. Indicates that the entity of the client's request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 414. Indicates that the request URI is longer than the server is willing to interpret.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 415. Indicates that the entity of the client's request is in a format not supported by the requested resource for the requested method.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 416. Indicates that none of the range specifier values in a Range request header overlap the current extent of the selected resource.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 417. Indicates that the expectation given in an Expect request header couldn't be met by the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.InternalServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 500. Indicates that the server encountered an unexpected condition which prevented it from fulfilling the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 501. Indicates that the server doesn't support the functionality required to fulfill the client's request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 502. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 503. Indicates that the server is currently unable to handle the client's request due to a temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 504. Indicates that a gateway or proxy server didn't receive a timely response from the upstream server or some other auxiliary server.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to status code 505. Indicates that the server doesn't support the HTTP version used in the client's request.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode
member.summary: Indicates the status code for the WebSocket connection close.

remarks.para:
The values of this enumeration are defined in
Section 7.4 of RFC 6455.
"Reserved value" cannot be sent as a status code in closing handshake by an endpoint.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Normal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1000. Indicates normal close.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Away
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1001. Indicates that an endpoint is going away.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ProtocolError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1002. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection due to a protocol error.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.UnsupportedData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1003. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a type of data that it cannot accept.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Undefined
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1004. Still undefined. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.NoStatus
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1005. Indicates that no status code was actually present. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.Abnormal
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1006. Indicates that the connection was closed abnormally. A Reserved value.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.InvalidData
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1007. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that contains data that is not consistent with the type of the message.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.PolicyViolation
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1008. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that violates its policy.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TooBig
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1009. Indicates that an endpoint is terminating the connection because it has received a message that is too big to process.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.MandatoryExtension
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1010. Indicates that a client is terminating the connection because it has expected the server to negotiate one or more extension, but the server did not return them in the handshake response.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.ServerError
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1011. Indicates that a server is terminating the connection because it has encountered an unexpected condition that prevented it from fulfilling the request.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.CloseStatusCode.TlsHandshakeFailure
member.summary: Equivalent to close status 1015. Indicates that the connection was closed due to a failure to perform a TLS handshake. A Reserved value.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Fin

member.remarks: The values of this enumeration are defined in Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Fin.More
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates more frames of a message follow.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Fin.Final
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates the final frame of a message.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Mask.Off
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates not masked.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Mask.On
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates masked.

The values of this enumeration are defined in
Section 5.2 of RFC 6455.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Cont
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates continuation frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Text
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates text frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Binary
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 2. Indicates binary frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Close
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 8. Indicates connection close frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Ping
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 9. Indicates ping frame.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.Opcode.Pong
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 10. Indicates pong frame.

If you would like to change the value of this field, it must be a number between and inclusive.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.Logger
member.summary: Provides a set of methods and properties for logging.

remarks.para: If you output a log with lower than the value of the property, it cannot be outputted.
The default output action writes a log to the standard output stream and the log file if the property has a valid path to it.
If you would like to use the custom output action, you should set the property to any Action<LogData, string> delegate.

member.name: T:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState
member.summary: Indicates the state of a WebSocket connection.
member.remarks:
The values of this enumeration are defined in
The WebSocket API.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.Connecting
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 0. Indicates that the connection has not yet been established.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.Open
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 1. Indicates that the connection has been established, and the communication is possible.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.Closing
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 2. Indicates that the connection is going through the closing handshake, or the close method has been invoked.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketState.Closed
member.summary: Equivalent to numeric value 3. Indicates that the connection has been closed or could not be established.

member.name: F:WebSocketSharp.WebSocketFrame.EmptyPingBytes
member.summary: Represents the ping frame without the payload data as an array of .
member.remarks: The value of this field is created from a non masked ping frame, so it can only be used to send a ping from the server.
